title: Today is one of the best days of year to buy a Roomba
text:

iRobot 
If you've ever considered buying a Roomba, chances are what held you back was its high price. 
Roombas rarely go on sale, but if you are on the fence about buying one, you can pick up a certified-refurbished version of the Roomba 650 for a good price. 
If you have an aversion to buying refurbished products, Amazon actually covers you pretty well. 
Each certified-refurbished product comes with an at minimum 90-day warranty, which should give you enough time to properly test all of this Roomba's features. 
The biggest of those features is being able to program the Roomba to vacuum your place seven times a week. This means you can leave your apartment's floor in a less-than-perfect state before work, and come back to a clean floor at night. The Roomba will self-dock after cleaning, too, so you won't need to look around your apartment for where it stopped cleaning, or where its battery died. 
The Roomba 650 has a three-stage-cleaning system, with sensors that can detect dirtier parts of your floor and spend more time there. Those same sensors can determine whether the Roomba is cleaning hardwood floors or carpets, and clean accordingly. 
While it's smart enough to avoid walls and stairs, the Roomba is also smart enough to avoid parts of the house that you don't want it to clean thanks to a "Virtual Wall" sensor. 
You set this external sensor down in an open door frame, and it sends out a signal that the Roomba perceives as a wall. This is a useful feature for homes and apartments with open floor plans, or if you choose to use the Roomba while you're home. 
The Roomba is one of those products that's always in high demand, and rarely goes on sale.
